meanings.definition: The state of being helical or spiral.
meanings.sent1: The seashell's helicity was mesmerizing as it spiraled outward.
meanings.sent2: The DNA molecule's helicity determines its overall structure.
meanings.sent3: The helicity of the tornado made it look like a giant swirling ice cream cone.
meanings.sent4: The helicity of the galaxy's arms created a beautiful spiral in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The helicity of the spring coil made it bounce up and down with energy.

meanings.definition: The projection of the spin of a particle along its direction of motion.
meanings.sent1: In physics class, we learned about the helicity of electrons and their spin.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the helicity of the particle to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The helicity of the spinning top fascinated the children as it twirled around.
meanings.sent4: The helicity of the spinning ballerina added grace to her dance performance.
meanings.sent5: The helicity of the spinning wheel created a hypnotic effect on the audience.

meanings.definition: The property of having a helix shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The staircase's helicity allowed people to ascend to the next floor.
meanings.sent2: The screw's helicity made it perfect for fastening objects together.
meanings.sent3: The helicity of the curly fries made them look like tiny spirals of deliciousness.
meanings.sent4: The helicity of the tornado-shaped cake delighted the party guests.
meanings.sent5: The helicity of the seashell's design inspired the artist to create a beautiful sculpture.
